tit.e: The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax
The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax
The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax

sen.j: 古都保存協力税（ことほぞんきょうりょくぜい）は、かつて京都市が制定した税条例に基づき実施された地方税のひとつである。
sen.e: The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was one of the local taxes, which was levied in accordance with a tax ordinance enacted by Kyoto city in the past.
The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was one of the local taxes, which was once levied in accordance with a tax ordinance enacted by Kyoto city.
The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was one of the local taxes, which was once levied in accordance with a tax ordinance enacted by Kyoto city.

sen.j: 以下、古都税と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Hereinafter referred to as the Old Capital Tax.
It is hereinafter referred to as the Old Capital Tax.
It is hereinafter referred to as the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 税が成立した場合、地方自治体の財布(財政)に入るお金が生じ納税者の財布(家計)からは出るお金が発生する。
sen.e: If taxation is once introduced, it yields money which goes into the purse (finances) of the local government as well as money which goes out from the purse (family budget) of the taxpayers.
The introduction of taxation yields money which goes into local government coffers from the pockets of the taxpayers.
The introduction of taxation yields money which goes into local government coffers from the pockets of the taxpayers.

sen.j: また自治体の財布から出ていく金は行政の業務コストとなり、住民は自治体の行政サービスを享受して還元してもらう。
sen.e: The money going out from the purse of a local government constitutes the operating cost of administration to be returned to the citizens who enjoy the administrative services.
The money spent from government funds covers administrative costs and returned to citizens who receive government services.
The money spent from government funds covers administrative costs and returned to citizens who receive government services.

sen.j: この流れをつくる地方税制は一定の形式によらなければ成立しない。
sen.e: A local taxation system which creates this cycle cannot be established without taking a certain form.
A local taxation system which creates this cycle cannot be established without taking a certain form.
A local taxation system which creates this cycle cannot be established without taking a certain form.

sen.j: 一定の形式とは税の徴収時期、徴収対象、徴収方法、徴収金額などを法律で定めておくというものである。
sen.e: This certain form means the way in which the time, the object, the method and the amount of tax collection are predetermined by law.
This certain form refers to the legal definition of the time, liability, method and amount of taxation.
This certain form refers to the legal definition of the time, liability, method and amount of taxation.

sen.j: 納税者に税を理解してもらい不満を和らげてもらうには必要な形式である。
sen.e: This form is essential for taxpayers to understand the taxation and to alleviate their discontent about the tax.
This form is essential for taxpayers to understand the taxation and to alleviate their discontent about the tax.
This form is essential for taxpayers to understand the taxation and to alleviate their discontent about the tax.

sen.j: 同時に税の趣旨から行政が一律に納税者より徴税する形式が実情にそぐわない場合もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, depending on purpose of taxation, a form in which tax is collected uniformly from taxpayers by an administrative body is sometimes inappropriate to the real situation.
On the other hand, depending on purpose of taxation, a form in which tax is collected uniformly from taxpayers by an administrative body is sometimes inappropriate to the real situation.
On the other hand, depending on purpose of taxation, a form in which tax is collected uniformly from taxpayers by an administrative body is sometimes inappropriate to the real situation.

sen.j: このため税法は例外の措置、時限立法を設けている。
sen.e: For this reason, tax laws involve temporary legislation and exception provisions.
For this reason, tax laws involve temporary legislation and exception provisions.
For this reason, tax laws involve temporary legislation and exception provisions.

sen.j: 例えば不動産を取得している場合にかかる固定資産税は基本的に学校や宗教施設の場合は課税しないというものがある。
sen.e: For example, schools and religious institution are not subject to Fixed Property Tax which is imposed on acquisition of real estate.
For example, schools and religious institution are not subject to Fixed Property Tax which is imposed on the acquisition of real estate.
For example, schools and religious institutions are not subject to Fixed Property Tax which is imposed on the acquisition of real estate.
sen.cmt: institutionをinstitutions に変更しました。

sen.j: 古都税を制定した京都市も学園都市であり寺社仏閣を市内に抱えている。
sen.e: Kyoto City, which established the Old Capital Tax, is not only an university town but also having Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines in the city.
Kyoto City, which established the Old Capital Tax, is not only an university city but also has Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines.
Kyoto City, which established the Old Capital Tax, is not only an university city but also has Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines.

sen.j: 左記の団体から固定資産税は歳入(財政に入るお金)へ入らない。
sen.e: These institutions do not have to pay Fixed Property Tax to be siphoned into the city revenues.
These institutions are exempt from paying Fixed Property Tax.
These institutions are exempt from paying Fixed Property Tax.

sen.j: また時限立法とは税制の見直しをするために期限を設け、廃止すべきか継続すべきかを判断させるものである。
sen.e: In addition, temporary legislation is aimed at setting a certain grace period during which a tax system is overhauled to decide whether it needs to be abolished or maintained.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, temporary legislation is aimed at setting a certain grace period during which a tax system is overhauled to decide whether it needs to be abolished or maintained.
In addition, temporary legislation is aimed at setting a certain grace period during which a tax system is overhauled to decide whether it needs to be abolished or maintained.

sen.j: よって、幅はあっても弾力的な運用が求められる。
sen.e: It requires flexible application no matter how wide its range of application may be.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It requires flexible application no matter how wide its range of application may be.
It requires flexible application no matter how wide its range of application may be.

sen.j: それでも税が成立すると行政は大きな権能を持つ。
sen.e: Nevertheless, once a taxation system is established, the administrative organization is invested with the huge power to enforce it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nevertheless, once a taxation system is established, the administrative organization is invested with great powers to enforce it.
Nevertheless, once a taxation system is established, the administrative organization is invested with great powers to enforce it.

sen.j: そのため、立法には成立までの十分な見立てが必要となる。
sen.e: Therefore, thorough examination of its legislation is required until it becomes effective.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, thorough examination of its legislation is required until it becomes effective.
Therefore, thorough examination of its legislation is required until it becomes effective.

tit.cmt: Changed to a more appropriate English title

sen.j: 都道府県や市町村は公共サービスへの対価として住民から税金を徴収する。
sen.e: Tax is collected by the administrative divisions of Japan (Tokyo-to, Hokkai-do, Osaka-fu, Kyoto-fu and remaining prefectures) and municipalities (cities, towns, and villages) in exchange for the public services provided by such administrative bodies.
Tax is collected by prefectures and municipalities in exchange for the provision of public services.
Tax is collected by prefectures and municipalities in exchange for the provision of public services.

sen.j: 「地方税法」は、地方自治体が住民から徴収できる税のかたち(税目)を定めている。
sen.e: Local Tax Act' stipulates tax items on which a local governments can impose taxes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The 'Local Tax Act' stipulates tax items on which a local governments can impose taxes.
The 'Local Tax Act' stipulates tax items on which a local governments can impose taxes.

sen.j: また、同法は自治体が独自の税目を創設できる旨も規定している。
sen.e: The act also allows each local government to establish its own tax item.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The act also allows each local government to establish its own tax items.
The act also allows each local government to establish its own tax items.

sen.j: 古都税は京都市が作った条例に基づく。
sen.e: The Old Capital Tax is based on an ordinance issued by Kyoto city.
The Old Capital Tax is based on an ordinance issued by Kyoto city.
The Old Capital Tax is based on an ordinance issued by Kyoto city.

sen.j: 古都税を創設したのは当時の京都市の市長であった今川正彦だった。
sen.e: The Old Capital Tax was established by Masahiko IMAGAWA, who was the mayor of Kyoto city at the time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Old Capital Tax was established by Masahiko IMAGAWA, who was the mayor of Kyoto city at the time.
The Old Capital Tax was established by Masahiko IMAGAWA, who was the mayor of Kyoto city at the time.

sen.j: 氏は同税は住民に対する税金ではなく、京都市内の寺社建物へ支払う拝観料へ課税し文化財を保護する市への協力を拝観者へ依頼するものと市議会へ説明している。
sen.e: According to his explanation to the City Assembly, the tax was imposed not on the citizens but on the entrance fee paid to the temples and the shrines in Kyoto city, with the intention of eliciting cooperation with the city from the visitors in protecting the cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to his explanation to the City Assembly, the tax was imposed not on the citizens but on the entrance fee paid to the temples and the shrines in Kyoto city, with the intention of eliciting cooperation with the city from the visitors in protecting its cultural properties.

According to his explanation to the City Assembly, the tax was imposed not on the citizens but on the entrance fee paid to the temples and the shrines in Kyoto city, with the intention of eliciting cooperation with the city from the visitors in protecting its cultural properties.

sen.j: 実施してから向こう10年間、対象寺社の拝観者は窓口で大人50円、小人30円を拝観料にプラスして支払う。
sen.e: For ten years after the enforcement of the act, the visitors to the temples and the shrines subject to the taxation have to pay an additional fee of 50 yen (for adults) or 30 yen (for children) as the tax imposed on the entrance fee.

For ten years after the enforcement of the act, visitors to the temples and the shrines subject to the tax had to pay an additional fee of 50 yen (for adults) or 30 yen (for children) as the tax imposed on the entrance fee.
sen.cmt: Reworded for past tense and fluency
sen.e: For ten years after the enforcement of the act, visitors to the temples and the shrines subject to the tax had to pay an additional fee of 50 yen (for adults) or 30 yen (for children) as the tax imposed on the entrance fee.

sen.j: 対象寺社は特別徴収義務者として市へ納める特別徴収である。
sen.e: It is in the form of special collection in which the temples and the shrines subject to the taxation act as special tax collectors and pay the tax income to the city.
This was in the form of a special collection in which the temples and the shrines subject to the tax acted as special tax collectors and paid the tax income to the city.
sen.cmt: Reworded for past tense and fluency
sen.e: This was in the form of a special collection in which the temples and the shrines subject to the tax acted as special tax collectors and paid the tax income to the city.

sen.j: これに対して、自治体の財政収入を市外からの来訪者へ負担してもらうのは応益の原則に反しているのではないかとの意見もあった。
sen.e: Against this way of taxation, there was an opinion that owning a revenue source of local finance to the visitors from outside the city may be opposed to the benefit principle of taxation.
There was also the opinion that imposing taxes on visitors from outside the city may be in opposition to the benefit principle of taxation.
There was also the opinion that imposing taxes on visitors from outside the city may be in opposition to the benefit principle of taxation.

sen.j: 拝観は宗教行為であるとする観点から、拝観料への課税は信教の自由を保障する憲法違反ではないかとする意見もあった。
sen.e: From the point of view that visiting temples and shrines is one of the religious activities, there was another opinion that the taxation of the entrance fee may be an act repugnant to the Constitution, which secures freedom of religion.

From the point of view that visiting temples and shrines is a religious activity, there was another opinion that the taxation of the entrance fee may be an act repugnant to the Constitution, which ensures freedom of religion.
sen.cmt: one of the religious activities > a religious activitysecures > ensures
sen.e: From the point of view that visiting temples and shrines is a religious activity, there was another opinion that the taxation of the entrance fee may be an act repugnant to the Constitution, which ensures freedom of religion.

sen.j: 今川市長が古都税を入れた動機には、かつて京都市が古都税以前にも同類の観光税を実施していた例があるとされる。
sen.e: It is also said that an earlier example of introducing a similar taxation by Kyoto city motivated mayor IMAGAWA to establish the Old Capital Tax.
It is also said that an earlier example of introducing a similar taxation by Kyoto city motivated mayor IMAGAWA to establish the Old Capital Tax.
It is also said that an earlier example of introducing a similar taxation by Kyoto city motivated mayor IMAGAWA to establish the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 1956年、京都市で文化観光税（正式には文化観光施設税。通称は文観税）が実施された。
sen.e: In 1956, the Tax on Cultural Tourist (the full title of which is the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities, and which is commonly known as the Bunkan tax) was enforced in Kyoto city.
In 1956, the Tax on Cultural Tourism (the full title of which is the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities, and which is commonly known as the Bunkan tax) was enforced in Kyoto city.
In 1956, the Tax on Cultural Tourism (the full title of which is the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities, and which is commonly known as the Bunkan tax) was enforced in Kyoto city.

sen.j: 岡崎の京都会館はこの文観税の賜物である。
sen.e: Kyoto Kaikan Hall located at Okazaki was built owing to the benefit of this Bunkan tax.
Kyoto Kaikan Hall located at Okazaki was built owing to the benefit of this Bunkan tax.
Kyoto Kaikan Hall located at Okazaki was built owing to the benefit of this Bunkan tax.

sen.j: 7.5年の時限立法であったたため、1964年に市は再び同様の条例を5年の時限立法で創設した。
sen.e: As it had been an act valid only for a limited time, seven and the half years, the city enacted the similar ordinance in 1964 as temporary legislation with five-year term limit.
As it had been an act valid only for a limited time of 7.5 years, the city enacted a similar ordinance in 1964 as temporary legislation with a five-year term limit.
sen.cmt: , seven and the half years > of 7.5 yearsthe > aAdded "a"
sen.e: As it had been an act valid only for a limited time of 7.5 years, the city enacted a similar ordinance in 1964 as temporary legislation with a five-year term limit.

sen.j: この際に条例反対の意見があったため当時の高山義三市長は今後同種の税を新設や延長することはないという覚書を反対する寺社と交わしている。
sen.e: At this time, due to the opposition against this ordinance, Yoshizo TAKAYAMA, the mayor at the time, exchanged memorandums with the opposing temples and shrines in which he stated that the same kind of taxation would be neither enforced nor extended thereafter.

At this time, due to the opposition against this ordinance, Yoshizo TAKAYAMA, the mayor at the time, exchanged memorandums with the opposing temples and shrines in which he stated that the same kind of taxation would be neither enforced nor extended thereafter.

At this time, due to the opposition against this ordinance, Yoshizo TAKAYAMA, the mayor at the time, exchanged memorandums with the opposing temples and shrines in which he stated that the same kind of taxation would be neither enforced nor extended thereafter.

tit.e: Chronology of the Old Capital Tax
Chronology of the Old Capital Tax

sen.j: 関連年表を以下に記す。
sen.e: The following is the chronology of the related matters.
The following is the chronology of events relating to the Old Capital Tax.
The following is the chronology of events relating to the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 1950年2月8日、京都市長選挙、高山義三当選、革新市政成立（やがて保守へ）。
sen.e: On February 8, 1950, a reformist municipal government (which became conservative afterward) was established with winning of Yoshizo TAKAYAMA in the mayoralty election of Kyoto city.
February 8, 1950: A reformist municipal government (which subsequently became conservative) was established with Yoshizo TAKAYAMA's win in the Kyoto City mayoral election.
February 8, 1950: A reformist municipal government (which subsequently became conservative) was established with Yoshizo TAKAYAMA's win in the Kyoto City mayoral election.

sen.j: 1950年4月20日、京都府知事選挙、蜷川虎三当選、革新府政成立。
sen.e: On April 20, 1950, a reformist prefectural government was established with winning of Torazo NINAGAWA in the election for a prefectural governor of Kyoto.
April 20, 1950: A reformist prefectural government was established with Torazo NINAGAWA's win in the Kyoto prefectural governor election.
April 20, 1950: A reformist prefectural government was established with Torazo NINAGAWA's win in the Kyoto prefectural governor election.

sen.j: 1956年10月1日、京都市文化観光施設税創設実施。
sen.e: On October 1, 1956, the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities of Kyoto city was enforced.
October 1, 1956: The Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities of Kyoto City was enacted.
October 1, 1956: The Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities of Kyoto City was enacted.

sen.j: 1964年9月1日、京都市文化保存特別税制定。
sen.e: On September 1, 1964, the Special Tax for the Cultural Preservation of Kyoto City was enacted.
September 1, 1964: The Special Tax for the Cultural Preservation of Kyoto City was enacted.
September 1, 1964: The Special Tax for the Cultural Preservation of Kyoto City was enacted.

sen.j: 1985年7月10日、京都市、古都保存協力税創設。
sen.e: On July 10, 1985, the Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was established.
July 10, 1985: The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was established.
July 10, 1985: The Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax was established.

sen.j: 古都税の施行は古都税騒動と呼ばれる政治事件を起こした(経緯を参照)。
sen.e: The enforcement of the Old Capital Tax provoked an incident called Dispute over the Old Capital Tax (See the details below).
The enforcement of the Old Capital Tax provoked an incident known as the Old Capital Tax Dispute (See the details below).
sen.cmt: called > known asAdded "the"Dispute over the Old Capital Tax > Old Capital Tax Dispute
sen.e: The enforcement of the Old Capital Tax provoked an incident known as the Old Capital Tax Dispute (See the details below).

sen.j: 1988年3月31日京都市は古都保存協力税を廃止した。
sen.e: On March 31, 1988, Kyoto city abolished the Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.
March 31, 1988: Kyoto City abolished the Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.
March 31, 1988: Kyoto City abolished the Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.

tit.e: Details of the Dispute over the Old Capital Tax
Timeline of the Old Capital Tax Dispute
Timeline of the Old Capital Tax Dispute

sen.j: 1982年3月、京都市財務消防委員会で文化観光税の復活が議論された。
sen.e: In March 1982, the revival of the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities (the Bunkan tax) was discussed in the finance and firefighting committee of Kyoto city.
March 1982: The revival of the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities (the Bunkan tax) was discussed in the finance and firefighting committee of Kyoto City.
March 1982: The revival of the Tax on Cultural Tourist Facilities (the Bunkan tax) was discussed in the finance and firefighting committee of Kyoto City.

sen.j: この年の夏、市長は再び文観税を創設する声明を出した。
sen.e: In the summer of that year, the mayor made a statement of enacting the Bunkan tax for the second time.
In the summer of that year, the mayor made a statement of enacting the Bunkan tax for the second time.
In the summer of that year, the mayor made a statement of enacting the Bunkan tax for the second time.

sen.j: 1983年1月、臨時市議会にて共産党が審議継続を求めるが古都税条例が可決された。
sen.e: In January 1983, the ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was approved in an extraordinary city assembly in spite of the request from the Communist Party to carry the bill over to the next session.
January 1983: The ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was approved in an extraordinary city assembly in spite of the request from the Communist Party to carry the bill over to the next session.
January 1983: The ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was approved in an extraordinary city assembly in spite of the request from the Communist Party to carry the bill over to the next session.

sen.j: 2月に京都市仏教会は条例の無効確認を求めた訴えを京都地裁へ起こした。
sen.e: In February of that year, Kyoto City Buddhism Organization filed a suit in the Kyoto district court demanding the affirmation of the invalidity of the ordinance.
In February of that year, the Kyoto City Buddhism Organization filed a suit in the Kyoto district court demanding the affirmation of the invalidity of the ordinance.
In February of that year, the Kyoto City Buddhism Organization filed a suit in the Kyoto district court demanding the affirmation of the invalidity of the ordinance.

sen.j: 1984年7月、京都市は自治大臣へ古都税創設の申請を出した。
sen.e: In July 1984, Kyoto city sent in an application to the Minister of Home Affairs for establishment of the Old Capital Tax.
July 1984: Kyoto City sent in an application to the Minister of Home Affairs for the establishment of the Old Capital Tax.
July 1984: Kyoto City sent in an application to the Minister of Home Affairs for the establishment of the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 1985年1月、京都市仏教会は京都市が古都税を施行した場合に24の寺社が拝観停止に踏み切ると宣言した。
sen.e: In January 1985, Kyoto City Buddhism Organization declared that twenty-four temples and shrines would take the step of refusing visitors in case Kyoto city should enforce the Old Capital Tax.
January 1985: The Kyoto City Buddhism Organization declared that twenty-four temples and shrines would take the step of refusing visitors in the event that Kyoto City enforced the Old Capital Tax.
sen.cmt: ConsistencyAdded "The"case > the event thatcity > Cityshould enforce > enforced
sen.e: January 1985: The Kyoto City Buddhism Organization declared that twenty-four temples and shrines would take the step of refusing visitors in the event that Kyoto City enforced the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 3月度の定例市議会で古都税の初年度収入を含んだ昭和60年度一般会計予算案が可決された。
sen.e: The bill of general account budget of the 1985 fiscal year which included the first year revenue from the Old Capital Tax was approved in the regular city assembly of March.
The bill of the general account budget of the 1985 fiscal year which included the first year revenue from the Old Capital Tax was approved at the regular city assembly of March.
The bill of the general account budget of the 1985 fiscal year which included the first year revenue from the Old Capital Tax was approved at the regular city assembly of March.

sen.j: 1985年4月、自治大臣は古都税創設を許可。
sen.e: In April 1985, the Minister of Home Affairs approved the enforcement of the Old Capital Tax.
April 1985: The Minister of Home Affairs approved the enforcement of the Old Capital Tax.
April 1985: The Minister of Home Affairs approved the enforcement of the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 但、施行は予定の4月より2か月ずらさせる。
sen.e: However, the month of enforcement which had been scheduled for April was postponed for two months.
However, the month of enforcement which had been scheduled for April was postponed for two months.
However, the month of enforcement which had been scheduled for April was postponed for two months.

sen.j: 京都市仏教会(およそ100)と京都府仏教会(およそ700)により京都仏教会が設立される。
sen.e: Kyoto City Buddhism Organization (consisting of approx. 100 temples) and Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Organization (consisting of approx. 700 temples) were joined to establish the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.

The Kyoto City Buddhism Organization (consisting of approximately 100 temples) and the Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Organization (consisting of approximately 700 temples) joined to establish the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.

The Kyoto City Buddhism Organization (consisting of approximately 100 temples) and the Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Organization (consisting of approximately 700 temples) joined to establish the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.

sen.j: 1985年7月10日、古都税条例が施行される。
sen.e: On July 10, 1985, the ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was enacted.
July 10, 1985: The ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was enacted.
July 10, 1985: The ordinance for the Old Capital Tax was enacted.

sen.j: 京都仏教会に加盟する寺院の一部は拝観停止を実行した（第一次拝観停止開始）。
sen.e: Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed the refusal of visitors (The first refusal of visitors).
Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the first refusal of visitors).
Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the first refusal of visitors).

sen.j: 1985年8月8日、「古都税あっせん会議」(奥田東議長)による仲裁を京都仏教会と京都市は承諾(8.8和解)。
sen.e: On August 8, 1985, an arbitration offered by 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax', of which chairman was Azuma OKUDA, was accepted by the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto city (the 8.8 Reconciliation).

August 8, 1985; An arbitration offered by the 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax', of which the chairman was Azuma OKUDA, was accepted by the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto City (the 8.8 Reconciliation).

August 8, 1985; An arbitration offered by the 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax', of which the chairman was Azuma OKUDA, was accepted by the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto City (the 8.8 Reconciliation).

sen.j: 翌日に拝観停止は解除された。
sen.e: The refusal of visitors was called off in the day after.
The refusal of visitors was called off on the following day.
sen.cmt: in the day after > on the following day
sen.e: The refusal of visitors was called off on the following day.

sen.j: 和解案は非公開とされた。
sen.e: The terms of the reconciliation were not disclosed.
The terms of the reconciliation were not disclosed.
The terms of the reconciliation were not disclosed.

sen.j: 1985年8月10日、京都市長選挙告示日。
sen.e: August 10, 1985, campaigning for the mayoral election of Kyoto city was permitted to start.
August 10, 1985: Campaigning for the mayoral election of Kyoto City was permitted to start.
August 10, 1985: Campaigning for the mayoral election of Kyoto City was permitted to start.

sen.j: 今川市長は市長選へ出馬、当選を果たす。
sen.e: The mayor IMAGAWA ran for the election and was elected.
Mayor IMAGAWA ran for the election and was elected.
Mayor IMAGAWA ran for the election and was elected.

sen.j: 1985年11月11日、「古都税あっせん会議」は最終和解案を京都仏教会と京都市へ提示した。
sen.e: On November 11, 1985, 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax' submitted the final reconciliation plan to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto city.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: November 11, 1985: The 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax' submitted the final reconciliation plan to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto City.
November 11, 1985: The 'Conciliation Council over the Old Capital Tax' submitted the final reconciliation plan to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization and Kyoto City.

sen.j: しかし仏教会は8.8和解の和解内容と異なると反発した。
sen.e: However, the Buddhist organization reacted to the plan with animosity saying that it was inconsistent with the terms of the 8.8 Reconciliation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the Buddhist organization reacted to the plan with animosity saying that it was inconsistent with the terms of the 8.8 Reconciliation.
However, the Buddhist organization reacted to the plan with animosity saying that it was inconsistent with the terms of the 8.8 Reconciliation.

sen.j: 1985年12月、京都仏教会に加盟する寺院の一部は拝観停止を実行した（第二次拝観停止開始）。
sen.e: In December 1985, some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed the refusal of visitors (The second refusal of visitors).
December 1985: Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the second refusal of visitors).
December 1985: Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the second refusal of visitors).

sen.j: 仏教会側は「三協西山」社長の西山正彦を交渉の窓口とした。
sen.e: The Buddhist organization installed Masahiko NISHIYAMA, who was the president of 'Sankyo Nishiyama', as the person to contact for negotiation.
The Buddhist organization installed Masahiko NISHIYAMA, who was the president of 'Sankyo Nishiyama', as the person to contact for negotiation.
The Buddhist organization installed Masahiko NISHIYAMA, who was the president of 'Sankyo Nishiyama', as the person to contact for negotiation.

sen.j: 1986年3月31日、3ヶ月後に和解できなければ拝観停止を再開するとして拝観停止は解除された。
sen.e: On March 31, 1986, the refusal of visitors was called off on condition that it would be resumed in case of failure of reconciliation within three months.
March 31, 1986: The refusal of visitors was called off on the condition that it would be resumed in case of failure to reconcile within three months.
March 31, 1986: The refusal of visitors was called off on the condition that it would be resumed in case of failure to reconcile within three months.

sen.j: 1986年7月1日、京都仏教会に加盟する寺院の一部は拝観停止を実行した（第三次拝観停止開始）。
sen.e: On July 1, 1986, some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed the refusal of visitors (The third refusal of visitors).
July 1, 1986: Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the third refusal of visitors).
July 1, 1986: Some of the temples belonging to the Kyoto Buddhist Organization executed their refusal of visitors (the third refusal of visitors).

sen.j: 1987年1月、西山正彦と今川正彦の和解交渉の会話を録音したテープが寺側から公表された。
sen.e: In January 1987, a recording of the settlement talks between Masahiko NISHIYAMA and Masahiko IMAGAWA was made public by the Buddhist organization.
January 1987: A recording of the settlement talks between Masahiko NISHIYAMA and Masahiko IMAGAWA was made public by the Buddhist organization.
January 1987: A recording of the settlement talks between Masahiko NISHIYAMA and Masahiko IMAGAWA was made public by the Buddhist organization.

sen.j: 録音内容に1985年の選挙についての会話があった。
sen.e: In the recording, there was a dialogue about the election of 1985.
In the recording, there was a dialogue about the election of 1985.
In the recording, there was a dialogue about the election of 1985.

sen.j: 1987年3月24日、京都地方検察庁は市長が古都税の和解について交渉した過程において利益誘導にあたる事実はないとして不起訴の決定を下した。
sen.e: In March 24, 1987, the Kyoto District Public Prosecutors Office decided not to prosecute the mayor because of no evidence of handing out benefits to his electoral district during his negotiation for the settlement of the Old Capital Tax.

March 24, 1987: The Kyoto District Public Prosecutors Office decided not to prosecute the mayor because of no evidence of handing out benefits to his electoral district during his negotiation for the settlement of the Old Capital Tax.

March 24, 1987: The Kyoto District Public Prosecutors Office decided not to prosecute the mayor because of no evidence of handing out benefits to his electoral district during his negotiation for the settlement of the Old Capital Tax.

sen.j: 1987年5月1日、京都仏教会は拝観停止を解除した。
sen.e: On May 1, 1987, the Kyoto Buddhist Organization called off the refusal of visitors.
May 1, 1987: The Kyoto Buddhist Organization called off its refusal of visitors.
May 1, 1987: The Kyoto Buddhist Organization called off its refusal of visitors.

sen.j: 1987年9月12日、京都仏教会より分離した京都府仏教連合会が発足した。
sen.e: On September 12, 1987, Kyoto-fu Bukkyo Rengokai (Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Association) was launched as a result of being separated from the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.
September 12, 1987: The Kyoto-fu Bukkyo Rengokai (Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Association) was launched as a result of being separated from the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.
September 12, 1987: The Kyoto-fu Bukkyo Rengokai (Kyoto Prefecture Buddhism Association) was launched as a result of being separated from the Kyoto Buddhist Organization.

sen.j: 1988年3月31日、京都市は古都保存協力税を廃止した。
sen.e: On March 31, 1988, Kyoto city abolished the Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.
March 31, 1988: Kyoto City abolished the Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.
March 31, 1988: Kyoto City abolished the Kyoto Old Capital Preservation Cooperation Tax.
